item.title: 香港捍卫货币带的努力才刚刚开始
item.description: 香港的货币防卫已成为威胁其新生经济复苏的平衡之举。【原文：Hong Kong’s currency defense has become a balancing act that threatens its nascent economic recovery.】

item.title: 韩国前总统尹炳世因戒严调查被捕
item.description: 韩国法院签发了对前总统尹锡烈的逮捕令，在他因试图对韩国实施戒严令而失败获释四个月后再次将其拘留。【原文：A South Korean court issued a warrant to arrest former President Yoon Suk Yeol, putting him back in detention four months after he was released over his botched attempt to put the country under martial law.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行为代币化结算研究项目选择公司
item.description: 澳大利亚中央银行已指定将参与代币化资产结算研究项目的行业参与者。【原文：Australia’s central bank has named the industry participants that will participate in a tokenized asset settlement research project.】

item.title: 交易商权衡美国库存增加和特朗普征税政策，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于交易商权衡了美国原油库存的大幅增加和唐纳德-特朗普总统的新关税税率浪潮，石油价格趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as traders weighed a large increase in US crude stockpiles and a wave of new tariff rates from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 关键收购交易结束，日本电力交易有望跃升
item.description: 日本电力期货的交易量将攀升，因为各公司都在为日本最大的公用事业公司之间的一项关键协议即将到期做准备，预计这一变化将对市场造成冲击。【原文：Trading volume in Japan’s power futures is set to climb as companies prepare for the upcoming expiration of a key agreement between the nation’s largest utilities, a shift expected to jolt the market.】

item.title: 提高关税后菲律宾计划与美国进行更多会谈
item.description: 马尼拉驻美国大使何塞-曼努埃尔-罗穆阿德斯（Jose Manuel Romualdez）表示，在华盛顿提高对东南亚国家的关税税率后，菲律宾将与美国进行进一步谈判。【原文：The Philippines will hold further negotiations with the US after Washington increased its planned tariff rate on the Southeast Asian nation, according to Manila’s ambassador to the US Jose Manuel Romualdez.】

item.title: S&P全球报告：德国消费增长助推企业乐观情绪
item.description: 根据 S&P Global Market Intelligence 的报告，德国企业对经济的乐观程度是 2022 年初以来最高的，并且两年来首次计划增加投资。【原文：German companies are the most optimistic about the economy since early 2022 and for the first time in two years plan to boost investments, according to a report by S&P Global Market Intelligence.】

item.title: 中国大亨将印尼打造成铝业巨头
item.description: 中国富豪们正以数十亿美元的项目为印尼铝业注入新的活力，这些项目与大约十年前在印尼镍矿资源上所下的巨额赌注不相上下，并有可能撼动全球金属市场。【原文：Chinese tycoons are turbo-charging Indonesia’s aluminum industry with multi-billion dollar projects that rival the vast bets made on the country’s nickel riches roughly a decade ago, and threaten to shake up the global market for the metal.】

item.title: 面对贸易风险，马来西亚人工智能引领的股市反弹出现回落
item.description: 去年，人工智能引领的涨势帮助马来西亚股市跑赢了地区同行，但这一涨势正在迅速瓦解，不断升级的贸易风险被认为会进一步削弱市场的吸引力。【原文：An artificial intelligence-led rally that helped Malaysian stocks outperform regional peers last year is fast unraveling, with escalating trade risks seen to further dampen the market’s appeal.】

item.title: 参议员寻求 "轻触 "加密货币市场，民主党人表示反对
item.description: 美国参议院的一个重要小组就拟议的数字资产监管问题展开了辩论，共和党人呼吁采取温和的方法，而民主党人则对潜在的漏洞和利益冲突提出了警告。【原文：A key US Senate panel took up the debate over proposed regulation of digital assets, with Republicans calling for a soft approach and Democrats warning about potential loopholes and conflicts of interest.】

item.title: Meta 以超过 2 亿美元的薪酬挖走了苹果公司的庞巴迪
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司为其 "超级智能 "团队的新成员开出了不同寻常的高额薪酬，其中包括为苹果公司前杰出工程师开出的超过 2 亿美元的薪酬。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. has made unusually high compensation offers to new members of its “superintelligence” team — including a more than $200 million package for a former Apple Inc. distinguished engineer.】

item.title: 科技股提振 S&P 500 指数后亚洲股市将反弹：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市将加入美股和比特币的涨势，这表明投资者正透过最新的关税标题关注企业利润和经济。【原文：Asian equities were set to join a rally in US shares and Bitcoin in a sign investors are looking through the latest tariff headlines to focus on corporate profits and the economy.】

item.title: 铜贸易商争相将金属运往夏威夷，以抓住巨额关税贸易的机会
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划征收 50%的关税，有可能对数月来一直困扰该行业的利润丰厚的套利贸易造成冲击，因此竞相将货物运入美国的铜贸易商正寻求将交货转移到夏威夷和波多黎各，以缩短装运时间。【原文：Copper traders racing to get cargoes into the US are looking to shift deliveries into Hawaii and Puerto Rico to cut shipment times, as Donald Trump’s plan for 50% tariffs threatens to slam the door on a hugely profitable arbitrage trade that has gripped the industry for months.】

item.title: 儿童零售商 Claire's 考虑破产美国业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，克莱尔百货公司（Claire's Stores Inc.【原文：Claire’s Stores Inc. is considering a potential bankruptcy for its US operations, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as the former fixture of shopping malls across the country struggles with weak demand, higher import costs and a heavy debt burden.】

item.title: 银行开始为收购博姿提供 42.5 亿美元债务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通和瑞银集团等华尔街银行已开始与投资者就 42.5 亿美元的债务方案进行早期定价讨论，以帮助 Sycamore Partners 收购英国药店 Boots。【原文：Wall Street banks including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and UBS Group AG have begun early pricing discussions with investors for a $4.25 billion debt package to help finance Sycamore Partners’ buyout of UK pharmacy Boots, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 收益率上升，市场为关键的 20 年期日本债券销售做好准备
item.description: 由于大选迫在眉睫，人们对财政扩张的担忧加剧，周四举行的 20 年期日本政府债券拍卖会将重新聚焦于收益率的上升。【原文：An auction of 20-year Japanese government bonds Thursday will beam the searchlight back on rising yields as a looming election heightens concerns about fiscal expansion.】

item.title: 特朗普的法案会引发 "大而美 "的能源紧缺吗？
item.description:
在 特朗普经济学中，我们将探讨立法对可再生能源的打击可能会如何推高电费并损害 美国在人工智能领域的竞争力。【原文：

On Trumponomics, we explore how the legislation’s attack on renewable energy may push up electricity bills and damage US competitiveness in AI.

】

item.title: 中东石油巨头称市场需要欧佩克+的供应惊喜
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯、阿拉伯联合酋长国和科威特这三个欧佩克核心产油国的高级官员周三一致表示，全球市场需要该产油国俱乐部在周末增加的超大规模供应。【原文：Senior officials from three of OPEC’s core producer nations — Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, and Kuwait — lined up on Wednesday to say that the super-sized addition of supply by the producer club at the weekend was needed by the global market.】

item.title: 欧佩克禁止五家主要新闻机构参加石油会议
item.description: 石油输出国组织（OPEC）不让世界五大新闻机构报道其在维也纳举行的两年一度的石油研讨会，该组织的部长和高级行业主管出席了此次会议。【原文：OPEC has excluded five of the world’s leading news organizations from covering its biennial oil seminar in Vienna, attended by the group’s ministers and senior industry executives.】

item.title: 比特币首次突破 112,000 美元后再创新高
item.description: 在股票等其他风险资产反弹的情况下，比特币首次突破 112,000 美元，创下历史新高。【原文：Bitcoin surpassed $112,000 for the first time, setting an all-time high with other risk assets such as equities rallying.】

item.title: 欧特克考虑收购工程软件公司 PTC
item.description: 据知情人士透露，欧特克公司（Autodesk Inc.【原文：Autodesk Inc. is weighing an acquisition of rival engineering-software provider PTC Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 佛罗里达 Brightline 计划为铁路线出售 4 亿美元债券
item.description: 被评为 "垃圾级 "的佛罗里达 Brightline Trains 是一条连接迈阿密和奥兰多的私营客运铁路，该公司计划发行多达 4 亿美元的免税债券，为资本项目和向坦帕的扩张提供资金。【原文：Brightline Trains Florida, the junk-rated private passenger railroad connecting Miami and Orlando, plans to issue as much as $400 million of tax-exempt bonds to finance capital projects and an expansion to Tampa.】

item.title: 安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）离开特拉华州前往内华达州，并告诉初创企业跟随其后
item.description: 硅谷风险投资公司安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）正在将其业务从特拉华州重新注册到内华达州，并呼吁其投资组合公司也这样做—；理由是担心该州存在 "针对创始人及其董事会 "的偏见。【原文：The Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz is reincorporating its business from Delaware to Nevada and calling for its portfolio companies to do the same — citing concerns over bias in the state “against founders and their boards.”】

item.title: 胡塞武装再次袭击红海船只，恐吓水手
item.description: 也门胡塞武装分子本周在红海发动了为期三天的袭击，击沉了两艘商船并杀害了船员，这严峻地提醒船主和船员穿越海上咽喉要注意风险。【原文：Yemen’s Houthi militants sank two commercial ships and killed sailors during three days of attacks in the Red Sea this week — a stark reminder to vessel owners and crews of the risks of traversing the maritime chokepoint.】

item.title: 比尔-阿克曼谋求职业网球赛冠军，却因提前出局而功亏一篑
item.description: 网球历史还需等待。【原文：Tennis history will have to wait.】

item.title: 私募股权投资支持的美国 IPO 带着大量杠杆回归
item.description: 私募股权公司正将其投资组合公司带回美国 IPO 市场，测试投资者对债务多于近期上市的其他公司的需求。【原文：Private equity firms are bringing their portfolio companies back to the US IPO market, testing investor demand for firms that have more debt than other recent listings.】

item.title: Quicken 的所有者探索如何出售这家财务软件先锋企业
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，个人财务软件的先驱之一 Quicken Inc.【原文：Quicken Inc., one of the pioneers in personal finance software, is exploring a potential sale that could value it at more than $1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 关于金属熔化的三点思考
item.description:
黄金、白银、铂金，现在还有铜。【原文：

Gold, silver, platinum and now copper.

】

item.title: 美国因批评以色列而制裁联合国人权专家
item.description: 美国对一名调查巴勒斯坦领土人权状况的联合国专家实施制裁，使双方早些时候因被指控有反以色列偏见而要求她下台后的争吵升级。【原文：The US imposed sanctions on a United Nations expert investigating human rights conditions in the Palestinian territories, escalating a feud after earlier calling for her ouster over allegations of anti-Israel bias.】

item.title: 费城联储指数显示美国政治紧张局势升至六年新高
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行公布的一项数据显示，在唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收法案和移民政策引发的冲突中，美国上个月的党派政治紧张局势飙升至六年来的最高点。【原文：Partisan political tensions in the US soared to a six-year high last month, according to a gauge published by the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, amid clashes over President Donald Trump’s tax bill and immigration policies.】
